authorships.raw_affiliation_string: Liora Sarfati is an anthropologist and folklorist whose specialism spans religion, society, culture, and the media. She holds a PhD from Indiana University, and is currently Lecturer at the Department of East Asian studies of Tel Aviv University. Her research explores the production of vernacular rituals in contemporary South Korea, and the recent protests in downtown Seoul. Her articles were published in Journal of American Folklore, Journal of Korean Studies, Asian Studies Review, Journal of Folklore Research, Urbanities, and as book chapters. Her book Contemporary Korean Shamanism: From Ritual to Digital is forthcoming with Indiana University Press.
